sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: A circle has a radius of 8 cm. Find the area of the sector that has an angle of 45 degrees.
message_2:
To find the area of a sector, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (angle/360) × π × radius²

In this case, the angle is 45 degrees and the radius is 8 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area of sector = (45/360) × π × 8²

Area of sector = (1/8) × π × 64

Area of sector = (1/8) × 64π

Area of sector = 8π cm²

So, the area of the sector with an angle of 45 degrees and a radius of 8 cm is 8π cm².
